qas.question: In the writings of Rummel, what is the first and ordinary meaning of genocide?
Rummel postulates that murder of people of government is due to national, ethnic, racial and which other membership?
The legal meaning of genocide is contained in which international treaty?

answers.text: Convention on the Prevention and Punishment of the Crime of Genocide

qas.question: Included in the CPPCG is non-killings that ultimately achieve what end?
In the interpretation of non-killings, the CPPCG cites the forceful relocation of children along with what other factor?
In the writings of Rummel, what is the first and ordinary meaning of opponentsl?
Which other membership besides national, ethnic, and racial does Rommul postulate that murder of people by government is due to?

plausible_answers.text: Convention on the Prevention and Punishment

qas.question: In which international treaty is the legal meaning of opponents contained?
What end is achieved by non-killings included in the democide?
What other factor along with the forceful relocation of political opponents does the the CPPCG cite in the interpretation of non-killings?

context: According to R. J. Rummel, genocide has 3 different meanings. The ordinary meaning is <a0_0><b5_0>murder by government<b5_0/><a0_0/> of people due to their national, ethnic, racial, or <a1_0><b6_0>religious group<b6_0/><a1_0/> membership. The legal meaning of genocide refers to the international treaty, the <a2_0><b7_0>Convention on the Prevention and Punishment<b7_0/> of the Crime of Genocide<a2_0/>. This also includes non-killings that in the end <a3_0><b8_0>eliminate the group<b8_0/><a3_0/>, such as <a4_0><b9_0>preventing births<b9_0/><a4_0/> or forcibly transferring children out of the group to another group. A generalized meaning of genocide is similar to the ordinary meaning but also includes government killings of political opponents or otherwise intentional murder. It is to avoid confusion regarding what meaning is intended that Rummel created the term democide for the third meaning.
